definition: dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream

sentences.english: It was only a fancy; yet a fancy will sometimes be importunate.
sentences.chinese: 它只是一個幻夢，但是有時幻夢是會糾纏不休的。

sentences.english: It was only a fancy; yet a fancy will sometimes be importunate.
sentences.chinese: 它只是一個幻夢，但是有時幻夢是會糾纏不休的。

sentences.english: He could see that clearly now, and laugh at himself and the dreams he had dreamed.
sentences.chinese: 他嘲笑自己和自己的幻夢。

sentences.english: Uninhibited envy of any absurd dreams of living beings.
sentences.chinese: 任何荒誕不羈羨煞衆生的幻夢。

sentences.english: You are my pillar and my fantasy.
sentences.chinese: 你便是我的支柱，我的幻夢。

sentences.english: But when youth, the dream, departs.
sentences.chinese: 可青春，這一幻夢，一旦離開。

sentences.english: This, of course, is but a pipe-dream.
sentences.chinese: 這當然只是個黃金的幻夢。

sentences.english: I started up from my day-dreams and poured water from my jar on thy joined palms.
sentences.chinese: 我從幻夢中驚起把我罐裏的水倒在你掬着的手掌裏。

sentences.english: The harshness of everyday reality disenchanted him of his idealistic hopes .
sentences.chinese: 冷酷的日常現實使他從理想主義的幻夢中清醒過來。

sentences.english: While you are thinking it is a dream, he may be knowing it is a planet.
sentences.chinese: 你認爲那是一個幻夢，但他可能曉得那是一顆行星。

definition: to lie in disarray/to cut across/to traverse
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
to flicker/to flash on and off/to brighten and fade
the ways of the world/social behavior
